objects.name: Title
objects.string:
The Ultimate Level Editor
by gametemplates.itch.io

events.comment:
For more game templates and examples visit gametemplates.itch.io
Make sure you run this scene first

If new game button is clicked, set global value game to new and start the editor
also change the color of text

If load game button is clicked, set global value game to load and start the editor
the loading process will be handled by the editor
also change the color of text

objects.name: Message
objects.string:
Press left mouse button to create tiles. Press I key to open tile selection menu
Use right mouse button to delete tiles. Press S key to save the level, Q to go back to menu

events.comment:
For more game templates and examples visit gametemplates.itch.io
Make sure you run the Menu scene first
At the beginning, set the cell width and height of the in-game grid (it is not the grid used in the scene editor)

events.name: Show and Hide tile selection layer

events.comment: show/hide the tile layer when the i key is pressed

If tiles layer is visible, check if a tile is clicked
if clicked, get tile animation and store it inside a variable
then hide the layer again
set cursorTile animation to be the animation of the selected tile
If tile selection layer is not visible, if left mouse button is down and it is not over a tile object, create a new tile object and set animation using the variable
If right mouse button is down, and the mouse is over an object, delete the object
Create an object next to the mouse to display what tile we have selected
if save already exists, delete the save file, it is necessary to make sure new save data is not going to be mixed with the previously saved data
generate ID value for each instance of the Tile object
save position and animation of instance
If the text of global variable Game is Load, then load the last saved level, technically we re-create the entire level from scratch using the information we have saved

First we check if save of PositionX exists for the current instance (counter), if it does, then we should also have the two other values for Y position and animation.
We read the values from the file in to scene variables, and then we create an instance of Tile object and set position and animation using he values previously loaded
finally we increase the value of counter which is used to find the info of the next instance
it is going to repeat until the condition will be false and the save does not exists for the given instance (counter value). If it does not exist that means there is no more instances to create and we should have the entire level loaded.
In case the loading takes a long time you may want to cover the screen with a layer displaying a loading screen and hide it when loading is done. In this case it was not necessary as the loading takes only a moment

eventsFunctions.description: Snap the objects to the grid, which has the size defined in scene variables called cell_width and cell_height
eventsFunctions.name: Snap
